org.ow2.bonita.facade
Interface ManagementAPI

public interface ManagementAPI

Workflow process deployment operations. Individual or grouped deployment of objects relating to the process definition: businessArchive, JAR file, java class data for connectors, ....

Author:
Marc Blachon, Guillaume Porcher, Charles Souillard, Miguel Valdes, Pierre Vigneras
See Also:
Connector

Method Summary
<E extends AbstractUUID>
void
addExceptionsToRule(java.lang.String ruleName, java.util.Set<E> exceptions)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method add exceptions to a rule identified by its name and so increase the scope of the rule.
 void addMetaData(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
          Adds or updates a meta data.
 void applyRulesToEntity(java.lang.String entityID, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> rules)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to impose conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance applying rules to a user (entity) defines what access the user has or does not have.
 void applySameRulesToOtherEntities(java.lang.String entityID, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> entities)
          Provides entities with the same privilege than entity.

          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.

Method Detail

deploy

ProcessDefinition deploy(BusinessArchive businessArchive)
                         throws DeploymentException
Deploys the given businessArchive into Bonita server. A businessArchive can be build using BusinessArchiveFactory class.

Parameters:
businessArchive - businessArchive to deploy
Returns:
the deployed process
Throws:
DeploymentException - if an error occurs while deploying the given Bar
BonitaInternalException - if an exception occurs.

deployJar

void deployJar(java.lang.String jarName,
               byte[] jar)
               throws DeploymentException
Deploys a JAR giving its bytes table.

Parameters:
jarName - the jar name
jar - the bytes table of the JAR.
Throws:
DeploymentException - if a class has already been deployed with its name.
BonitaInternalException - if an other exception occurs.

removeJar

void removeJar(java.lang.String jarName)
               throws DeploymentException
Removes a JAR according to its name.

Parameters:
jarName - the JAR name.
Throws:
DeploymentException - if the JAR name is not a JAR file or the JAR cannot be found in the repository or a deployed process is still using a class of the JAR file.
BonitaInternalException - if an other exception occurs.

deleteProcess

void deleteProcess(ProcessDefinitionUUID processUUID)
                   throws ProcessNotFoundException,
                          UndeletableProcessException,
                          UndeletableInstanceException
Deletes from journal and history:
  • the process
  • all instances of this process.

      • Parameters:
      processUUID - the process UUID to delete
      Throws:
      ProcessNotFoundException - if the process cannot be found
      UndeletableProcessException - if the process cannot be deleted
      UndeletableInstanceException - if at least a process instance cannot be deleted
      BonitaInternalException - if an other exception occurs.

deleteAllProcesses

void deleteAllProcesses()
                        throws UndeletableInstanceException,
                               UndeletableProcessException
Deletes from journal and history :
  • all processes
  • all instances of these processes.

      • Throws:
      UndeletableInstanceException - if at least a process instance cannot be deleted
      UndeletableProcessException - if at least a process cannot be deleted
      BonitaInternalException - if an other exception occurs.

             throws DeploymentException

Parameters:

Throws:
DeploymentException - if a process is not in disable state

archive

void archive(ProcessDefinitionUUID processUUID)
             throws DeploymentException
Archive a process. An archived process cannot be enable anymore.

Parameters:
processUUID - the process definition UUID
Throws:
DeploymentException - if a process is not in disable state

createRule

<E extends AbstractUUID> Rule createRule(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String label,
                                         java.lang.String description,
                                         java.util.Set<E> exceptions,
                                         Rule.RuleType type)
                throws RuleAlreadyExistsException
The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method creates a rule identified by its name.
It means that the entities bound to this rule will NOT follow the global policy anymore.

Type Parameters:
E -
Parameters:
name -
label -
description -
exceptions -
type -
Returns:
the newly created rule
Throws:
RuleAlreadyExistsException

deleteRule

void deleteRule(java.lang.String name)
                throws RuleNotFoundException
The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method deletes a rule identified by its name.
It means that the entities bound to this rule will then follow the global policy (unless they are bound to another rule).

Parameters:
name -
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
RuleNotFoundException

applyRulesToEntity

void applyRulesToEntity(java.lang.String entityID,
                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> rules)
                        throws RuleNotFoundException
The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to impose conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance applying rules to a user (entity) defines what access the user has or does not have.

Parameters:
entityID -
rules -
Throws:
RuleNotFoundException

removeRulesFromEntity

void removeRulesFromEntity(java.lang.String entityID,
                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> rules)
                           throws RuleNotFoundException
The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to remove conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance removing rules previously applied to a user (entity) defines what access the user has or does not have.

Parameters:
entityID -
rules -
Throws:
RuleNotFoundException

Parameters:
entityID -
Returns:
a set of rules.

getDefaultPolicy

PrivilegePolicy getDefaultPolicy()
Get the default policy.
PrivilegePolicy.ALLOW_BY_DEFAULT: Means that by default all entities are allowed to act on everything. Except the items listed in rules.
PrivilegePolicy.DENY_BY_DEFAULT: Means that by default all entities are NOT allowed to act on anything. Except the items explicitly listed in rules.

Returns:
the default policy

setDefaultPolicy

void setDefaultPolicy(PrivilegePolicy newPolicy,
                      boolean negateRules)
Update the default policy.
PrivilegePolicy.ALLOW_BY_DEFAULT: Means that by default all entities are allowed to act on everything. Except the items listed in rules.
PrivilegePolicy.DENY_BY_DEFAULT: Means that by default all entities are NOT allowed to act on anything. Except the items explicitly listed in rules.

Parameters:
negateRules - if set to true all the rules will be updated to respect the new policy. If set to false the rules will not be updated.

getNumberOfRules

long getNumberOfRules(Rule.RuleType ruleType)
Get the number of rules having the given type.

Parameters:
ruleType -
Returns:
the number of rules.
